item.title: Choice modeling with context effects: Generalization for observational data
item.description: This paper presents a generalized approach for modeling choice that allows the analysis of context effects (attraction, compromise, and similarity) in large observational datasets, overcoming limitations of traditional laboratory-based methods. By ex ante calculating context features for multi-option, multi-attribute choices, this methodology simplifies model estimation and was successfully applied to air traveler choice data, demonstrating its potential for managerial decision-making in product design.
